body:
### Problem

According to Nvim doc

```help
                                                         *lua-package-path*
Nvim automatically adjusts |package.path| and |package.cpath| according to the
effective 'runtimepath' value. Adjustment happens whenever 'runtimepath' is
changed. `package.path` is adjusted by simply appending `/lua/?.lua` and
`/lua/?/init.lua` to each directory from 'runtimepath' (`/` is actually the
first character of `package.config`).
```
However, when I run `:=package.path`, it doesn't include any paths related to `rtp`
```
./?.lua;/build/nvim/parts/nvim/build/.deps/usr/share/luajit-2.1/?.lua;/usr/local/share/lua/5.1/?.lua;/usr/local/share/lua/5.1/?/init.lua;/build/nvim/parts/nvim/build/.deps
/usr/share/lua/5.1/?.lua;/build/nvim/parts/nvim/build/.deps/usr/share/lua/5.1/?/init.lua
```
Similar things also happen with `package.cpath`

It seems that this happens since Nvim 0.5.

Nvim 0.4 has the same doc in `:h lua-require`, but `package.path` has all of `rtp`, unlike Nvim 0.5+

### Steps to reproduce
```sh
nvim --clean
```
```vim
:=package.path
:=package.cpath
```

### Expected behavior

According to the doc, it should also have paths from `rtp`

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.0-dev-1736+g6982106f8c                                                                                                                                           Build type: RelWithDebInfo                                                                                                                                                  LuaJIT 2.1.1736781742

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

No, in Vim 9.1.1024, `:lua print(package.path)` returns this 
```
/home/brianhuster/.config/vim/lua/?.lua;/home/brianhuster/.config/vim/lua/?/init.lua;/tmp/.mount_vimMMZoqN/usr/share/vim/vimfiles/lua/?.lua;/tmp/.mount_vimMMZoqN/usr/share /vim/vimfiles/lua/?/init.lua;/tmp/.mount_vimMMZoqN/usr/share/vim/vim91/lua/?.lua;/tmp/.mount_vimMMZoqN/usr/share/vim/vim91/lua/?/init.lua;/tmp/.mount_vimMMZoqN/usr/share/v im/vim91/pack/dist/opt/matchit/lua/?.lua;/tmp/.mount_vimMMZoqN/usr/share/vim/vim91/pack/dist/opt/matchit/lua/?/init.lua;/tmp/.mount_vimMMZoqN/usr/share/vim/vim91/pack/dist /opt/comment/lua/?.lua;/tmp/.mount_vimMMZoqN/usr/share/vim/vim91/pack/dist/opt/comment/lua/?/init.lua;/home/brianhuster/.config/vim/pack/brianhuster/opt/lazy/autosave.nvim /lua/?.lua;/home/brianhuster/.config/vim/pack/brianhuster/opt/lazy/autosave.nvim/lua/?/init.lua;/home/brianhuster/.config/vim/pack/brianhuster/opt/lazy/copilot.vim/lua/?.l ua;/home/brianhuster/.config/vim/pack/brianhuster/opt/lazy/copilot.vim/lua/?/init.lua;/tmp/.mount_vimMMZoqN/usr/share/vim/vimfiles/after/lua/?.lua;/tmp/.mount_vimMMZoqN/us r/share/vim/vimfiles/after/lua/?/init.lua;/home/brianhuster/.config/vim/after/lua/?.lua;/home/brianhuster/.config/vim/after/lua/?/init.lua;/media/brianhuster/D/Projects/vi m-dirvish/lua/?.lua;/media/brianhuster/D/Projects/vim-dirvish/lua/?/init.lua;/home/brianhuster/.config/nvim/lua/?.lua;/home/brianhuster/.config/nvim/lua/?/init.lua;/usr/lo cal/share/lua/5.3/?.lua;/usr/local/share/lua/5.3/?/init.lua;/usr/local/lib/lua/5.3/?.lua;/usr/local/lib/lua/5.3/?/init.lua;/usr/share/lua/5.3/?.lua;/usr/share/lua/5.3/?/in it.lua;./?.lua;./?/init.lua
```

### Operating system/version

Kubuntu 24.04

### Terminal name/version

konsole 23.08.5

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

snap, but Nvim 0.4 was from appimage

comment_data.body: It still implements that semantics (as for actually requiring packages), but internally to be more effective so it is not reflected by printing `:lua= package.path` literally. Need a doc update.

milestone.description: Low priority items. We plan to work on this but don't have a target date.
milestone.title: backlog

title: `'rtp'` not included in `package.path` and `package.cpath`
